intro: Exothostemon gracilis, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in pairs along its stems. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by berries that are often eaten by birds. Its roots form haustoria, which penetrate the host tree's vascular system to extract water and nutrients. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly impact the health of its host if left unchecked.
